doc.field: Philip Howard photographs of the Racquet and Tennis Club
Philip Howard photographs of the Racquet and Tennis Club

Commemorative book issued for the centenary of the Racquet and Tennis Club's building at 370 Park Avenue, with an introduction by Samuel G. White and 41 color and black-and-white photographs by Philip Howard. The book is unpaginated, so, in the list below, the archivist has supplied bracketed numbers that correspond to each photograph-and-caption's position in the volume.

[01] | Clubhouse, built 1918 [02] | Lobby with WWII Memorial Plaque [03] | Stair to Second floor. Tennis Player (1897) sculpted by Fitzgerald Cornwall Peploe [04] | East Lounge [05] | East Lounge [06] | Eagle, sculptor unknown [07] | Loggia [08] | Dining room, chandeliers from prior clubhouse [09] | Library [10] | Dressing room [11] | East Court, Tennis [12] | Passage to East Court [13] | East Court toward Grille [14] | East Court towards Pell Room [15] | East Court Scorer's Box [16] | East Court panorama [17] | East Court panorama [18] | East Court [19] | Gallery, East Court [20] | Tambour, West Court [21] | Tambour, East Court [22] | East Court from Pell Room [23] | Racquets Court [24] | Gallery, Racquets Court [25] | Racquets Court from Gallery, World Champion James Stout on left [26] | Squash Doubles Court [27] | Squash Doubles Court from gallery [28] | Squash Singles Court No. 3 [29] | Pool [30] | Dry Sauna [31] | The Slab Room [32] | Dressing Room [33] | Dressing Room [34] | Bar, mural by Edwin Austin Abbey [35] | Billiards Room [36] | Billiards Room [37] | Billiards Room, Cue Rack [38] | East Lounge at Christmas [39] | Front Desk [40] | Alley [41] | Club Fa√ßade
